str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and the middle voice of a derivative of muthos; to relate near, i.e. encourage, console.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Soon, quickly, hastily. Adverb from tachus; briefly, i.e. speedily, or rapidly.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tomb, sepulcher, monument. From mneme; a remembrance, i.e. Cenotaph.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
